thread.title: Liverpool fans think Man United’s goal was illegal
thread.title_full: Liverpool fans think Man United’s goal was illegal

author: Benjamin Newman
title: Liverpool fans think Man United’s goal was illegal
text:
Liverpool fans think Man United’s goal was illegal   Man United 1 – Liverpool 1 
The question of whether Man United get the rub of the green in Premier League matches was a topic of conversation on Sunday after the 1-1 draw against Liverpool. 
In his post match presser, Jose Mourinho openly questioned how the referees have been treated the Red Devils this season. 
Liverpool took the lead at Old Trafford via the penalty spot: James Milner converted. 
After the match, the Special One wondered how it is that in 25 matches in all competitions this season, Man United have only had one penalty given their way. 
Moreover, he discussed how referee Michael Oliver has now awarded three penalties against Man United in the EPL. 
Mourinho never called officials biased towards his club, but he definitely hinted at it. Liverpool fans think Man United’s goal was illegal 
But, on the flipside, Liverpool fans felt Man United’s late leveller shouldn’t have stood. 
Why? Because in the build up to Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s header, Antonio Valencia was spotted in an offside position on the right hand side. 
See the tweets on Man United’s goal v Liverpool below. What's the lino doing? Valencia is off-side in the build up to that equaliser. Great game mind. pic.twitter.com/5RASIzjF6s 
— Richard Keys (@richardajkeys) January 15, 2017 What's the lino doing? Valencia is off-side in the build up to that equaliser. Great game mind. pic.twitter.com/5RASIzjF6s 
— Richard Keys (@richardajkeys) January 15, 2017 No talk of Pogba's assault on Hendo or the offside for United's goal. I thought these would be good talking points, surely. @SkyFootball
